title: Data and Data Governance
section: Section 2 — Requirements for High-Risk AI Systems
summary: Article 10 sets detailed requirements for data and data governance for high-risk AI systems. Providers must use training, validation and testing datasets that meet strict quality criteria and implement robust data governance practices, including design choices, data collection, preparation, bias assessment and mitigation, and identification of data gaps. Datasets must be relevant, sufficiently representative, as error-free as possible and statistically appropriate for the intended purpose and context of use. The Article also allows, under strict conditions and safeguards, the exceptional processing of special categories of personal data solely for bias detection and correction, with limitations on re-use, strong security and access controls, and mandatory deletion. For systems not using model training techniques, these obligations apply at least to testing datasets.
